column4: hi everyone, need recomendations on what to run o a file server for sharing and backing up data. I also need authentication and maybe on the fly encription?!
SAMBA works great. you don't want to be running a file server as a VM though...
I was thinking on dl Ubuntu server and install samba there and see how it feels
yeah i did just that for a new server recently. i get 115MB/sec over gigabit LAN so all works well :D
wow 115 MBps. I also need to secure the connection to Smaba, what if someone starts sniffing traffic on the LAN?
this friend has confidential data, it needs to be secured when it is stored or transmited
you can set samba to be locked down on a per-IP basis, so you could set all the PCs to be statically addressed then permit only the right ones. also then have user+pass on top
that's not really going to happen with samba. or windows clients ;)
with a sniffer bad haxor can scope the LAN and impersonate the real owner IP, is the authentication secured?
just found the wiki for samba, uggghh, to much to read
I meant, is the authentication process encrypted or on the clear?
hehe, yeah you don't really need to read it all
now you found the wiki that can answer your questions :)
yeap! i guess I'll read it. Did you install any backup app? or just using rsync and old school tools only?
